Utilities

This section documents general utility functions used within the project.

Create Header for Codeblock

create_header.create_header(title: str) → str

Creates a formatted header string with borders and padding.

The function generates a header string that includes a top and bottom border, along with padding on both sides of the title. The length of the header adjusts based on the length of the title to ensure a minimum header length, providing a visually appealing and consistent format for headers.

Parameters

title (str) – The title text to be included in the header.

Returns

A formatted header string with borders and padding.

Return type

str

Example usage:

header = create_header("General Information")
print(header)

This would output:

############################################################
######              General Information               ######
############################################################

Note that the actual output will adjust in width depending on the length of the title.
